'''Albert II'''  ({{lang-de|Albrecht}}; 28 March 1522{{snd}}8 January 1557) was the [[Margrave]] of [[Principality of Bayreuth|Brandenburg-Kulmbach]] (Brandenburg-Bayreuth) from 1527 to 1553.
He was a member of the [[Franconia]]n branch of the [[House of Hohenzollern]].
Because of his bellicose nature, Albert during his lifetime was given the cognomen ''Bellator'' ("the Warlike"). 
Posthumously, he became known as    ''[[Alcibiades]]''.
